Articles.Content: Are solar eclipses from the surface of Kerbin possible?
Yes it is! Since mun orbit is exactly straight!

Yes, though given the limitations of Unity, the results are less impressive than you'd expect.

The MÃƒÂ¼n's orbit is in the same plane as Kerbin's so, I would expect the time between eclipses to be ~39 hours, 12 minutes. Duration would be approximately 12 minutes. Seeing them at KSC might be a bit rarer.
It's a bit easier to see them from the surface of the moon, though. But trust me, it happens.
So does it create an actual eclipse effect? i.e. the whole area goes dark
Just the area around you goes dark. You'll likely be able to see spots that should be dark but are actually light because of the limitations of Unity.

The area does not go dark, but the sun does get obscured temporarily.
